paragraphs.content: Chapter 20
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 20

paragraphs.content: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

paragraphs.content: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

paragraphs.content: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

paragraphs.content: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.

paragraphs.content: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

paragraphs.content: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?

paragraphs.content: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.

paragraphs.content: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

paragraphs.content: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

paragraphs.content: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

paragraphs.content: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the Lord hath made even both of them.

paragraphs.content: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

paragraphs.content: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

paragraphs.content: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

paragraphs.content: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

paragraphs.content: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

paragraphs.content: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

paragraphs.content: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

paragraphs.content: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

paragraphs.content: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

paragraphs.content: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the Lord, and he shall save thee.

paragraphs.content: Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Divers weights are an abomination unto the Lord; and a false balance is not good.

paragraphs.content: Man’s goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Man’s goings are of the Lord; how can a man then understand his own way?

paragraphs.content: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make inquiry.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make inquiry.

paragraphs.content: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

paragraphs.content: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The spirit of man is the candle of the Lord, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

paragraphs.content: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

paragraphs.content: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the gray head.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the gray head.

paragraphs.content: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
